clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of WB-EMS and Dietetic Treatment on Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Whole Body Electromyostimulation (WB-EMS) and Dietetic Treatment on Patients With Malignant Disease in a Curative or Palliative Treatment Situation

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the effects of 12 weeks of whole body electrostimulation (WB-EMS) and dietetic treatment in patients with malignant disease on curative or palliative treatment situation on body composition, muscle strength and quality of life.

primary_outcome.description: Lean Body Mass (LBM) and Appendicular Skeletal Muscle Mass (ASMM) as assessed by Dual-Energy-xRay Absorptiometry (DXA) and bioelectrical impedance analysis (BIA)
Isokinetic muscle strength of the leg extensors and -flexors as assessed by isokinetic leg strength
QoL as assessed by ECOG/WHO Performance Status, Karnofsky-Index and Depression Scores

secondary_outcome.description: Aerobic capacity as assessed by 6 min walking test

arm_group.description: "usual care" with no physical or dietary intervention
20 min WB-EMS Training (2 per week) + dietetic treatment with protein-rich diet (protein > 1,3 g/kg body weight)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- malignant disease: colon carcinoma, stomach cancer, oesophageal cancer, pancreas carcinoma, liver cell carcinoma, cholangiocarcinoma, bronchial carcinoma, mamma carcinoma, cervix cancer, prostate cancer, renal cell carcinoma, malignant melanoma, patients with leukaemia or Graft-versus-Host-Disease after bone marrow transplantation, tumour diseases of the cervical, pharyngeal or mouth area
- curative or palliative treatment situation
- men and women over, at least 18 years or older
Exclusion Criteria:
- coincident participation in other interventional trials
- cardiovascular events
- use of medications with influence on muscular metabolism
- epilepsy
- severe neurological diseases
- skin lesions in the area of electrodes
- energy active metals in body
